text: Hello Arran! I'm good thank you, how are you?
I've enjoyed my Christmas and New Year, spent a nice time with my family
Dexter sent me your mentor profile which gave me a brief idea about you :slightly_smiling_face: I liked your skills — especially your interests outside of work, seemed very exciting and interesting

I signed up to Prospela last year and I enjoyed the support I got from my mentors as well as Dexter and Emma. I think this is a great platform to get answers to your questions from a professional in the particular field that you're interested in

So, over the year my curiosity has definitely changed — in terms of what I'd like to learn. Last year I was exploring different career paths, I went from being interested in teaching to settling with Architecture (for now, of course). But this year I was trying to nail my personal statement/CV stuff. Dexter recommended I speak to you now that I've sent my personal statement off and I will be getting interviews from universities. I've actually only had about 2 interviews in my life so far haha, so I'm really nervous because I've only been awkward and quiet during them which is bad :confused:
I'm great thank you! Glad to hear you've enjoyed your Christmas and New Year :grinning:
Thank you... if you have any questions or would like to know some more about me and my professional experience, feel free to ask anytime.
Also, I'm happy that you've found Prospela to be a useful support resource!
Interesting to hear about your change in preference from Teaching to Architecture, what drove that change?
Your personal statement and CV is definitely something I can help with, if you still need some support with them?
And interview preparation is my specialty :grin: So we can 100% work on your interview skills together!!
Can you tell me what has made you feel nervous / awkward in your previous interviews? (don't worry if you can't put a finger on it... just interesting for me to see where you head is at)
Hope you're having a nice weekend!
